comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Garrett Droppers was an academic and diplomat from the United States. Droppers was born in Milwaukee, Wisconsin to John and Gertrude Droppers on April 12, 1860. (...) From 1898 to 1906, he served as President of the University of South Dakota. In 1912, he was a delegate to the Democratic National Convention. Droppers was appointed by Woodrow Wilson as U.S. Ambassador to Greece and Montenegro from 1914 to 1920. Garrett Droppers died on July 7, 1927 in Williamstown, Massachusetts. No picture in the Wikipedia article.

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: trialsanderrors, thanks for the additional information. Since he was ambassador to Greece during WWI, I wonder if he tried to influence them enter the war. We will correct the spelling of his first name.
